EmailTemplate.name: WBN-2016-10-26-Financial Services Webinar.EMAIL-Invitation
EmailTemplate.subject: Tomorrow! Best Practices for Financial Services IT | Turbonomic Webinar Series
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<[[https://turbonomic.com/resources/turbonomic-webinar-series-best-practices-for-financial-services?utm_source=turbonomic&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fi-serv-wbnr-2016&utm_content=10252016]]> Hi {{lead.First Name:default=There}},
In 2016, IT spending throughout the financial services sector is expected to increase to roughly $480 billion dollars worldwide. It’s no wonder that organizations are investing billions of dollars in the complex IT systems that run their business – but how can they ensure that they are getting the most out of what they have, while also preventing downtime? Join us tomorrow October 26th, 2016 at 2pm ET <[[https://turbonomic.com/resources/turbonomic-webinar-series-best-practices-for-financial-services?utm_source=turbonomic&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fi-serv-wbnr-2016&utm_content=10202016]]> and hear from Eric Wright, financial services technology architect turned Turbonomic evangelist, who will share his unique industry insight into how financial services organizations can assure quality of service while elevating IT teams to focus on strategic pursuits. Join us as we cover:
- Unique challenges financial services organizations face in ensuring continuous availability of mission critical workloads such as online banking platforms, high frequency trading applications, and risk management software. - The implications of current industry trends for FiServ IT teams, such as the emergence of FinTech startups and the growing presence of mobile platforms. - How financial services organizations can use Turbonomic to enhance, scale and assure performance of their cloud operations while maximizing existing infrastructure investments
<[[https://turbonomic.com/resources/turbonomic-webinar-series-best-practices-for-financial-services?utm_source=turbonomic&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=fi-serv-wbnr-2016&utm_content=10252016]]> - The Turbonomic Team
